fields.description: The various jsp pages in the UI are all missing a DOCTYPE declaration.  This causes the pages to render incorrectly on some browsers, such as IE9.  Every UI page should have a valid tag, such as <!DOCTYPE HTML>, as their first line.  There are 31 files that need to be changed, all in the core\src\webapps tree.

comments.body: This fix should work on all modern browsers.  Older browsers will ignore the new doctype, so they should be no worse than the existing code which lacks a doctype all together.

-1 overall.  Here are the results of testing the latest attachment 
  http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12504575/HADOOP-7827-branch-0.20-security.patch
  against trunk revision .

    +1 @author.  The patch does not contain any @author tags.

    -1 tests included.  The patch doesn't appear to include any new or modified tests.
                        Please justify why no new tests are needed for this patch.
                        Also please list what manual steps were performed to verify this patch.

    -1 patch.  The patch command could not apply the patch.

Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HADOOP-Build/394//console

This message is automatically generated.
need to fix patch file

Hey Dave, there's a secret to submitting both patches: if you submit the one for trunk LAST, then the test-patch robot will run correctly.  (It currently doesn't support running non-trunk patches.) Re-submitting the trunk patch to re-run test-patch.

+1 code review, pending test-patch results.

If we regenerate the patch for any reason I'd prefer consistent use of a single blank line before the DOCTYPE declaration, but I won't require the patch to be redone just for that.

-1 overall.  Here are the results of testing the latest attachment 
  http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12504838/HADOOP-7827.patch
  against trunk revision .

    +1 @author.  The patch does not contain any @author tags.

    -1 tests included.  The patch doesn't appear to include any new or modified tests.
                        Please justify why no new tests are needed for this patch.
                        Also please list what manual steps were performed to verify this patch.

    -1 patch.  The patch command could not apply the patch.

Welcome Dave Vronay as a new Contributor!

This bug records the resolution for pre-split branches.
The sub-task bugs record the resolution for post-split branches/trunk.
Reopening bug and reverting this patch due to HADOOP-7867.  Need a solution that is also compatible with Mac Firefox.  Thanks.
Update target version from 1.0.0 to 1.1.0, upon release of version 1.0.0.

Hi folks,

I spent some time investigating the IE9 render issues on branch-1 (and regression mentioned in HADOOP-7867). If I see things correctly, the cause of the regression is browsers failing to load the css file. Now that we changed the browser mode to HTML5, it fails to load the css file if the returned server content type does not match the expected value (in this case text/css).

The problem for this seems to be in HttpServer.java, where {{QuotingInputFilter#doFilter}} always sets the context type to {{text/html}}. This was fixed with HADOOP-6496, so the missing piece is to backport this changelist. Will attach a patch for the backport.

Let me know if I should also rebase the changes to the latest trunk/branch-1.1, I'll be happy to do that.

Hope this helps
Attaching a patch that backports HADOOP-6496 to branch-1.1.
Ivan can you please post HADOOP-6496.branch-1.1.backport.patch patch to HADOOP-6496 jira

bq. Ivan can you please post HADOOP-6496.branch-1.1.backport.patch patch to HADOOP-6496 jira
Done, thanks
Attaching the branch-1.1 compatible patch.
Since HADOOP-6496 is backported to branch-1.1, it should be fine to also commit {{HADOOP-7827.branch-1.1.backport.patch}} to branch-1.1.
+1 for the branch-1.1 patch. Straightforward port to add <!DOCTYPE HTML>
I committed the patch to branch-1. Thank you Ivan.
